intro: Tephrosia thurberi, commonly known as Thurber's tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, hairy pods containing several seeds. Tephrosia thurberi is often found in wetlands, prairies, and along stream banks, contributing to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
